required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Mitoxantrone Hydrochloride Liposome Injection in Patients With Advanced Pancreatic Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Safety, Tolerability, and Efficacy of Mitoxantrone Hydrochloride Liposome Injection in Patients With Advanced Pancreatic Cancer: A Multicenter, Open-label, Phase Ⅱ Study

lead_sponsor.agency: CSPC ZhongQi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: CSPC ZhongQi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of mitoxantrone hydrochloride liposome injection in patients with advanced pancreatic cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multicenter, open-label, phase Ⅱ study aimed to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of mitoxantrone hydrochloride liposome injection in patients with advanced pancreatic cancer. Patients enrolled in this study will receive mitoxantrone hydrochloride liposome injection every 3 weeks (q3w, a cycle) until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, death, or withdrawal by investigator or patient decision (a maximum of 8 cycles).

primary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the proportion of patients who have a best overall response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) as per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1.

secondary_outcome.description: OS is defined as the time from the date of first dose until the date of death from any cause.
PFS is defined as the time from the date of first dose until the date of first documented progressive disease (PD) as per RECIST 1.1 or death from any cause, whichever occurs first
DCR is defined as the proportion of patients who have a response of CR/PR or stable disease (SD) as per RECIST 1.1.
DoR is defined as the time from the first assessment of CR or PR until the date of first occurrence of progressive disease （PD） as per RECIST 1.1 or death from any cause, whichever occurs first.

arm_group.description: Patients will receive mitoxantrone hydrochloride liposome injection every 3 weeks (q3w, a cycle).

intervention.description: 20 mg/m^2, IV, on day 1 of every 3 weeks (q3w, a cycle)
